title: Chinese Embassy offers 68 Congo students scholarships to study in China

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 75.83 million grant — via ETCA — for National Stadium Fire and Security System Upgrading Project (Linked to Project ID#72563 and ID#37266)
description: In October 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Costa Rica signed an RMB 75,832,900 ($10,922,739) grant agreement for the National Stadium Fire and Security System Upgrading Project. The grant proceeds were drawn from an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) that the parties signed on December 19, 2018.    The purpose of the project was to upgrade and renovate the security and fire systems of the National (Football) Stadium. The proceeds of the grant from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) were also to be used to support equipment delivery, Chinese technicians, and the training for Costa Rican personnel at the stadium. Central South Architectural Design Institute Co., Ltd (CSADI) was the contractor responsible for project design, and China Jiangxi Corporation for International Economic and Technical Cooperation (CJIC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Their work was overseen by the Costa Rican Institute of Sports and Recreation (Icoder).   Project implementation commenced on February 18, 2020 and was originally expected to reach completion within 6 months (August 2020). The project was ultimately completed on July 23, 2021. It also achieved MOFCOM ‘completion acceptance’ in July 2021. A project completion ceremony took place on September 3, 2021.

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.969 billion government concessional loan for 96 km Tiébissou-Bouaké Highway Project (Linked to Project ID#66367, #66325)
description: On August 30, 2018, during a visit to Beijing by President of Côte d’Ivoire Ouattara, the Chinese Government and the Government of Côte d’Ivoire signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the 96 km Tiébissou-Bouaké Highway Project. Then, on September 3, 2018, China Eximbank and the Government of Côte d’Ivoire signed an RMB 1,969,000,000 (CFA 171,508,021,525) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2018) 23 TOTAL NO. (665)] for the 96 km Tiébissou-Bouaké Highway Project. The GCL agreement was ratified by the Ivorian Council of Ministers on December 12, 2018 (via Décret n° 2018-924). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower was to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a commercial contract between the Government of Côte d’Ivoire and China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC), which was signed on November 3, 2017.   According to the Government of Côte d'Ivoire’s Aid Management Platform (AMP), as of April 2022, 17 loan disbursements (worth CFA 81,378,912,345) had been made: a CFA 24,255,398,726 disbursement on March 31, 2019, a CFA 2,328,504,363 disbursement on July 31, 2019, a CFA 267,708,719 disbursement on August 31, 2019, a CFA 1,497,918,884 disbursement on October 31, 2019, a CFA 1,644,198,692 disbursement on November 30, 2019, a CFA 6,988,667,300 disbursement on December 31, 2019, a CFA 1,799,219,878 disbursement on February 28, 2020, a CFA 2,545,593,567 disbursement on March 31, 2020, a CFA 1,865,655,329 disbursement on April 30, 2020, a CFA 2,018,475,154 disbursement on May 31, 2020, a CFA 1,099,120,168 disbursement on June 30, 2010, a CFA 1,311,146,676 disbursement on July 31, 2020, a CFA 769,209,524 disbursement on August 31, 2020, a CFA 3,048,153,031 disbursement on December 31, 2020, a CFA 1,062,845,867 disbursement on March 31, 2021, a CFA 5,680,700,701 disbursement on April 30, 2021, and a CFA 15,521,452,065 disbursement on June 30, 2021.  The purpose of this project is to construct a 96 km section of the two-way, four-lane, Northern Highway (Autoroute du Nord or l’Autoroute Abidjan-Frontière Nord or 北部公路) — with a design speed of 130 km per hour — between Tiébissou and Bouaké. The Tiebissou-Bouake road section consists of three subsections (known as ‘lots’): a 35 km subsection (29+450 at PK 64+450 or ‘Lot 1’); a 13.9 km subsection (known as 64+450 at PK 78+350) and a 11.726 km expressway at the entrance of Bouaké to the southern corridor (‘Lot 2’); and a 35 km subsection (78+350 at PK 113+350 or ‘Lot 3’). It also involves the construction of six interchanges, two market areas, one fuel station, a toll station, a weighing platform, eight road crossings, ten pedestrian crossings, and nine bridges (three highway bridges and six overpasses). The Tiebissou-Bouake road section is the second component of a larger highway construction project linking the cities of Yamoussoukro and Bouaké (known as the Yamoussoukro-Bouaké Road Construction Project). The first component is a road section between Yamoussoukro and Tiébissou financed by the Islamic Development Bank. The Northern Highway project aims to connect Abidjan, a coastal city on Cote d'Ivoire's southern border, to the northern border shared with Mali.   CRBC is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. A formal groundbreaking ceremony took place on November 29, 2018, and construction was expected to last 36 months. The Ivorian Minister of Equipment and Road Maintenance completed an on-site project inspection on May 28, 2020. As of September 2020, the project had achieved a 40% completion rate. Then, on May 10, 2021, 400 CRBC workers responsible for the construction of the Tiébissou-Bouaké highway announced a strike to demand better working conditions. Project implementation was further delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. As of November 26, 2021, more than 400 CRBC employees had received the two doses of the Sinopharm vaccine for COVID-19. The project is expected to reach completion on April 14, 2022.

title: ICBC and Standard Bank provide CFA 42 billion syndicated buyer’s credit loan for San Pédro Stadium Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#92251)
description: On March 6, 2018, ICBC and Standard Bank signed a syndicated buyer’s credit loan agreement worth CFA 42,080,765,991.49 with the Government of Cote d'Ivoire for the San Pédro Stadium Construction Project (captured via Project ID#60790). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that Sinosure provided $81.67 million of credit insurance (covering the loan’s principal and interest). It is also known that the borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance a commercial (EPC) contract between China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) and the Government of Cote d'Ivoire’s Ministry of Youth, Sports, and Leisure, which was also signed on March 6, 2018.   According to the Government of Côte d'Ivoire’s Aid Management Platform (AMP), the syndicated loan from ICBC and Standard Bank had achieved a 92.3% disbursement rate (CFA 38,842,531,925.14 out of CFA 42,080,765,991.49) as of December 31, 2022. The lenders made 6 disbursements (worth CFA 38,842,531,925.14) between 2019 and 2022: a CFA 3,410,847,701 disbursement on December 31, 2019, a CFA 6,257,514,416 disbursement on January 31, 2020, a CFA 2,774,324,403 disbursement on February 28, 2020, a CFA 12,575,086,225 disbursement on April 30, 2021, a CFA 5,722,207,924.75 disbursement on December 31, 2021, and a CFA 8,102,551,255.39 disbursement on December 31, 2022.    According to the Government of Côte d'Ivoire’s AMP, a second loan — or bond issue contract (‘Contrat d'émission d'obligation Petrus’) — worth CFA 15,312,691,693.94 was issued by ICBC London to the Government of Cote d’Ivoire on December 13, 2018 in support of the San Pédro Stadium Construction Project and the Korhogo Stadium Construction Project. As of December 31, 2022, this loan (captured via Project ID#92251) had not yet disbursed.   The purpose of the San Pédro Stadium Construction Project is to construct a new 20,000-seat Olympic stadium (with an area of ​​22,409 m², 2,000 parking spaces, access roads, and water, sanitation, electricity, and fiber optic infrastructure) in the western city of San Pédro (San Pedro) and an athletes' village (including 32 villas with five rooms each). Another objective of the project is to rehabilitate four training grounds (including the Auguste Denise stadium, a technical college, and a municipal high school). The San Pedro Olympic stadium is being built 200 meters from the road at the south-eastern entrance to the city of San Pedro near the road to Abidjan. It is being built in preparation for the facility to host the 2023 African Cup of Nations football tournament.   The Côte d’Ivoire Branch of China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) [CCECC-CI or 中国土木工程集团（科特迪瓦）有限公司] is the general EPC contractor responsible for implementation. China Railway 19th Bureau, China Railway Urban Construction Group (CRUC), and Omni Travaux (a French company) also appear to be serving as sub-contractors. On November 9, 2018, CCECC, China Railway 19th Bureau, and China Railway Urban Construction Group (CRUC) signed a cooperation agreement to carry out this project together. A groundbreaking ceremony took place on February 23, 2019. Construction was initially scheduled to end on December 31, 2020. However, as of June 13, 2020, Director General Mariame Koné of the Direction Office National des Sports (ONS) reported that the project had only achieved a 25% completion rate. Project implementation delays resulted from the Covid-19 pandemic and the Government of Cote d'Ivoire not paying CCECC in a timely manner (upon receipt of invoices). As of the last quarter of 2020, the construction of the stadium resumed.

The lenders made 6 disbursements (worth CFA 38,842,531,925.14) between 2019 and 2022: a CFA 3,410,847,701 disbursement on December 31, 2019, a CFA 6,257,514,416 disbursement on January 31, 2020, a CFA 2,774,324,403 disbursement on February 28, 2020, a CFA 12,575,086,225 disbursement on April 30, 2021, a CFA 5,722,207,924.75 disbursement on December 31, 2021, and a CFA 8,102,551,255.39 disbursement on December 31, 2022.    According to the Government of Côte d'Ivoire’s AMP, a second loan — or bond issue contract (‘Contrat d'émission d'obligation Petrus’) — worth CFA 15,312,691,693.94 was issued by ICBC London to the Government of Cote d’Ivoire on December 13, 2018 in support of the San Pédro Stadium Construction Project and the Korhogo Stadium Construction Project. As of December 31, 2022, this loan (captured via Project ID#92251) had not yet disbursed.   The purpose of the San Pédro Stadium Construction Project is to construct a new 20,000-seat Olympic stadium (with an area of ​​22,409 m², 2,000 parking spaces, access roads, and water, sanitation, electricity, and fiber optic infrastructure) in the western city of San Pédro (San Pedro) and an athletes' village (including 32 villas with five rooms each). Another objective of the project is to rehabilitate four training grounds (including the Auguste Denise stadium, a technical college, and a municipal high school). The San Pedro Olympic stadium is being built 200 meters from the road at the south-eastern entrance to the city of San Pedro near the road to Abidjan. It is being built in preparation for the facility to host the 2023 African Cup of Nations football tournament.   The Côte d’Ivoire Branch of China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) [CCECC-CI or 中国土木工程集团（科特迪瓦）有限公司] is the general EPC contractor responsible for implementation. China Railway 19th Bureau, China Railway Urban Construction Group (CRUC), and Omni Travaux (a French company) also appear to be serving as sub-contractors. On November 9, 2018, CCECC, China Railway 19th Bureau, and China Railway Urban Construction Group (CRUC) signed a cooperation agreement to carry out this project together. A groundbreaking ceremony took place on February 23, 2019. Construction was initially scheduled to end on December 31, 2020. However, as of June 13, 2020, Director General Mariame Koné of the Direction Office National des Sports (ONS) reported that the project had only achieved a 25% completion rate. Project implementation delays resulted from the Covid-19 pandemic and the Government of Cote d'Ivoire not paying CCECC in a timely manner (upon receipt of invoices). As of the last quarter of 2020, the construction of the stadium resumed.
